00018 ## -*- texinfo -*-
00019 ##
00020 ## @fv {@var{P} =} phantom ('Shepp-Logan', @var{n})
00021 ##
00022 ## Produces the Shepp-Logan phantom, with size @var{n} x @var{n}.
00023 ## If @var{n} is omitted, 256 is used.
00024 ##
00025 ## @defunx {@var{P} =} phantom ('Modified Shepp-Logan', @var{n})
00026 ##
00027 ## Produces a modified version of the Shepp-Logan phantom which has
00028 ## higher contrast than the original,  with size @var{n} x @var{n}.
00029 ## If @var{n} is omitted, 256 is used.
00030 ##
00031 ## @defunx {@var{P} =} phantom (@var{ellipses}, @var{n})
00032 ##
00033 ## Produces a custom phantom using the ellipses described in @var{ellipses}.
00034 ## Each row of @var{ellipses} describes one ellipse, and must have 6 columns:
00035 ## @{I, a, b, x0, y0, phi@}:
00036 ##  @table @abbr
00037 ##  @item I
00038 ##    is the additive intensity of the ellipse
00039 ##
00040 ##  @item a
00041 ##    is the length of the major axis
00042 ##
00043 ##  @item b
00044 ##    is the length of the minor axis
00045 ##
00046 ##  @item x0
00047 ##    is the horizontal offset of the centre of the ellipse
00048 ##
00049 ##  @item y0
00050 ##    is the vercal offset of the centre of the ellipse
00051 ##
00052 ##  @item phi
00053 ##    is the counterclockwise rotation of the ellipse in degrees,
00054 ##    measured as the angle between the x axis and the ellipse major axis.
00055 ##
00056 ## @end table
00057 ##
00058 ## The image bounding box in the algorithm is @{[-1, -1], [1, 1]@}, so the
00059 ## values of a, b, x0, y0 should all be specified with this in mind.
00060 ## If @var{n} is omitted, 256 is used.
00061 ##
00062 ## @defunx {@var{P} =} phantom (@var{n})
00063 ##
00064 ## Creates a modified Shepp-Logan phantom with size @var{n} x @var{n}.
00065 ##
00066 ## @defunx {@var{P} = } phantom ()
00067 ##
00068 ## Creates a modified Shepp-Logan phantom with size 256 x 256.
00069 ## @end defun
00070 ##
00071 ## Create a Shepp-Logan or modified Shepp-Logan phantom.
00072 ##
00073 ## A phantom is a known object (either real or purely mathematical) that
00074 ## is used for testing image reconstruction algorithms.  The Shepp-Logan
00075 ## phantom is a popular mathematical model of a cranial slice, made up
00076 ## of a set of ellipses.  This allows rigorous testing of computed 
00077 ## tomography (CT) algorithms as it can be analytically transformed with
00078 ## the radon transform (see the function @command{radon}).
00079 ##
00080 ## Example:
00081 ## 
00082 ## @example
00083 ##   P = phantom (512);
00084 ##   imshow (P, []);
00085 ## @end example
00086 ##
00087 ## References:
00088 ##
00089 ##  Shepp, L. A.; Logan, B. F.; Reconstructing Interior Head Tissue 
00090 ##  from X-Ray Transmissions, IEEE Transactions on Nuclear Science,
00091 ##  Feb. 1974, p. 232.
00092 ##
00093 ##  Toft, P.; "The Radon Transform - Theory and Implementation", Ph.D. thesis,
00094 ##  Department of Mathematical Modelling, Technical University 
00095 ##  of Denmark, June 1996.
00096 
00097 function p = phantom (varargin)
00098 
00099   [n, ellipses] = read_args (varargin {:});
00100 
00101   # Blank image
00102   p = zeros (n);
00103 
00104   # Create the pixel grid
00105   xvals = (-1 : 2 / (n - 1) : 1);
00106   xgrid = repmat (xvals, n, 1);
00107 
00108   for i = 1:size (ellipses, 1)    
00109     I   = ellipses (i, 1);
00110     a2  = ellipses (i, 2)^2;
00111     b2  = ellipses (i, 3)^2;
00112     x0  = ellipses (i, 4);
00113     y0  = ellipses (i, 5);
00114     phi = ellipses (i, 6) * pi / 180;  # Rotation angle in radians
00115     
00116     # Create the offset x and y values for the grid
00117     x = xgrid - x0;
00118     y = rot90 (xgrid) - y0;
00119     
00120     cos_p = cos (phi); 
00121     sin_p = sin (phi);
00122     
00123     # Find the pixels within the ellipse
00124     locs = find (((x .* cos_p + y .* sin_p).^2) ./ a2 ...
00125      + ((y .* cos_p - x .* sin_p).^2) ./ b2 <= 1);
00126     
00127     # Add the ellipse intensity to those pixels
00128     p (locs) = p (locs) + I;
00129   endfor
00130 endfunction
00131 
00132 function [n, ellip] = read_args (varargin)
00133   n = 256;
00134   ellip = mod_shepp_logan ();
00135   
00136   if (nargin == 1)
00137     if (ischar (varargin {1}))
00138       ellip = select_phantom (varargin {1});
00139     elseif (numel (varargin {1}) == 1)
00140       n = varargin {1};
00141     else
00142       if (size (varargin {1}, 2) != 6)
00143         error ("Wrong number of columns in user phantom");
00144       endif
00145       ellip = varargin {1};
00146     endif
00147   elseif (nargin == 2)
00148     n = varargin {2};
00149     if (ischar (varargin {1}))
00150       ellip = select_phantom (varargin {1});
00151     else
00152       if (size (varargin {1}, 2) != 6)
00153         error ("Wrong number of columns in user phantom");
00154       endif
00155       ellip = varargin {1};
00156     endif
00157   elseif (nargin > 2)
00158     warning ("Extra arguments passed to phantom were ignored");
00159   endif
00160 endfunction
00161 
00162 function e = select_phantom (name)
00163   if (strcmpi (name, 'shepp-logan'))
00164     e = shepp_logan ();
00165   elseif (strcmpi (name, 'modified shepp-logan'))
00166     e = mod_shepp_logan ();
00167   else
00168     error ("Unknown phantom type: #s", name);
00169   endif
00170 endfunction
00171 
00172 function e = shepp_logan
00173   #  Standard head phantom, taken from Shepp & Logan
00174   e = [  2,   .69,   .92,    0,      0,   0;  
00175       -.98, .6624, .8740,    0, -.0184,   0;
00176       -.02, .1100, .3100,  .22,      0, -18;
00177       -.02, .1600, .4100, -.22,      0,  18;
00178        .01, .2100, .2500,    0,    .35,   0;
00179        .01, .0460, .0460,    0,     .1,   0;
00180        .02, .0460, .0460,    0,    -.1,   0;
00181        .01, .0460, .0230, -.08,  -.605,   0; 
00182        .01, .0230, .0230,    0,  -.606,   0;
00183        .01, .0230, .0460,  .06,  -.605,   0];
00184 endfunction
00185 
00186 function e = mod_shepp_logan
00187   #  Modified version of Shepp & Logan's head phantom, 
00188   #  adjusted to improve contrast.  Taken from Toft.
00189   e = [  1,   .69,   .92,    0,      0,   0;
00190       -.80, .6624, .8740,    0, -.0184,   0;
00191       -.20, .1100, .3100,  .22,      0, -18;
00192       -.20, .1600, .4100, -.22,      0,  18;
00193        .10, .2100, .2500,    0,    .35,   0;
00194        .10, .0460, .0460,    0,     .1,   0;
00195        .10, .0460, .0460,    0,    -.1,   0;
00196        .10, .0460, .0230, -.08,  -.605,   0; 
00197        .10, .0230, .0230,    0,  -.606,   0;
00198        .10, .0230, .0460,  .06,  -.605,   0];
00199 endfunction
